Process module¶

class Process.Laplace_Convolution¶

Bases: object

convolute(grid, coords, coords1)¶

Selectively applies convolution operator to the cells with provided coordinates

Parameters

  • grid_out – 3D array with convolution results

  • grid – original 3D array

  • coords – coordinates of surface cells

  • coords1 – coordinates of semi-surface cells

Returns

to grid_out array

kernel_convolution()¶

Applies convolution to the central cell in the given 3D grid.

If one of the neighbors is Zero, it is replaced by the central value.

Parameters

grid – array to convolute

Returns

changes grid array

laplace_term(surfa, semi_surf, D, dt)¶

Calculates diffusion term for all surface cells using convolution

Parameters

  • grid – 3D precursor density array

  • surfa – surface cells collection

  • semi_surf – semi-surface cells collection

  • D – diffusion coefficient

  • dt – time step

Returns

to grid array

Process.define_ghosts(substrate, surface)¶

Defines ghost cells for every axis and direction separately.

Parameters

  • substrate – 3D precursor density array

  • surface – surface cells matrix

Returns

six lists with coordinates of ghost cells and six lists of corresponding values

Process.define_irradiated_area(y, x, effective_radius_relative: int)¶

Defines boundaries of the effectively irradiated area

Parameters

  • y – y-coordinate of the beam

  • x – x-coordinate of the beam

  • effective_radius_relative – a distance at which intensity is lower than 99% of the distribution

Returns

four values defining an area in x-y plane

Process.deposition(deposit, substrate, flux_matrix, surface_bool, dt)¶

Calculates deposition on the surface for a given time step dt (outer loop)

Parameters

  • deposit – 3D deposit array

  • substrate – 3D precursor density array

  • flux_matrix – matrix of electron flux distribution

  • dt – time step

Returns

writes back to deposit array

Process.flush_structure(substrate: numpy.ndarray, deposit: numpy.ndarray, init_density: numpy.float32 = 0.8382352941176471, init_deposit=0.0, volume_prefill=0.0)¶

Resets and prepares initial state of the printing framework

Parameters

  • substrate – 3D precursor density array

  • deposit – 3D deposit array

  • init_density – initial precursor density on the surface

  • init_deposit – initial deposit on the surface, can be a 2D array with the same size as deposit array along 0 and 1 dimensions

  • volume_prefill – initial deposit in the volume, can be a predefined structure in an 3D array same size as deposit array (constant value is virtual and used for code development)

Returns

Process.flux_matrix(matrix, surface_irradiated)¶

Calculates a matrix with electron flux distribution

Parameters

  • matrix – output matrix

  • surface_irradiated – irradiated area

Returns

to matrix array

Process.laplace_term_rolling(grid, ghosts_bool, D, dt, add=0, div: int = 0)¶

Calculates diffusion term for all surface cells using rolling

Parameters

  • grid – 3D precursor density array

  • ghosts_bool – array representing ghost cells

  • D – diffusion coefficient

  • dt – time step

  • add – Runge-Kutta intermediate member

  • div –

Returns

to grid array

Process.make_tuple(arr)¶

DEPRICATED Converts a matrix array of z-indices(y=i, x=j) to a sequence of indices

Parameters

arr – array to convert

Returns

tuple(list[z], list[y], list[x]), indexing-ready

Process.pe_flux(r)¶

Calculates PE flux at the given radius according to Gaussian distribution.

Parameters

r – radius from the center of the beam.

Process.precursor_density(flux_matrix, substrate, surface_bool, semi_surf_bool, ghosts_bool, dt)¶

Recalculates precursor density on the whole surface

Parameters

  • flux_matrix – matrix of electron flux distribution

  • substrate – 3D precursor density array

  • surface_bool – array representing surface cells

  • semi_surf_bool – array representing semi-surface cells

  • ghosts_bool – array representing ghost cells

  • dt – time step

Returns

changes substrate array

Process.precursor_density_increment(dt, sub, flux_matrix, addon=0)¶

Calculates increment of the precursor density without a diffusion term

Parameters

  • dt – time step

  • sub – array of surface cells (2D for surface cells, 1D dor semi-surface cells)

  • flux_matrix – matrix of electron flux distribution

  • addon – Runge Kutta term

Returns

to sub array

Process.printing(loops=1)¶

Performs FEBID printing process in a zig-zag manner for given number of times

Parameters

loops – number of repetitions of the route

Returns

changes deposit and substrate arrays

Process.refresh(substrate, semi_s_bool, ghosts_bool, z, y, x)¶

Updates surface, semi-surface and ghost cells collections according to the provided coordinate of a newly deposited cell

Parameters

  • substrate – 3D precursor density array

  • semi_s_bool – array representing semi-surface cells

  • ghosts_bool – array representing ghost cells

  • z – z-coordinate of the cell above the new deposit

  • y – y-coordinate of the deposit

  • x – x-coordinate of the deposit

Returns

changes surface array, semi-surface and ghosts collections

Process.refresh_ghosts(substrate, ghosts_bool, x, y, z)¶

Updates ghost cells collection around the specified cell

Parameters

  • substrate – 3D precursor density array

  • ghosts_bool – array representing ghost cells

  • x – x-coordinates of the cell

  • y – y-coordinates of the cell

  • z – z-coordinates of the cell

Returns

changes ghosts array

Process.rk4(dt, sub, flux_matrix=0)¶

Calculates increment of precursor density by Runge-Kutta method

Parameters

  • dt – time step

  • sub – array of surface cells

  • flux_matrix – matrix of electron flux distribution

Returns

Process.rk4_diffusion(grid, ghosts_bool, D, dt)¶

Calculates increment of the diffusion term

Parameters

  • grid – 3D array

  • ghosts_bool – array representing ghost cells

  • D – diffusion coefficient

  • dt – time step

Returns

3D array with the increments

Process.show_yield(deposit, summ, summ1, res)¶
Process.update_surface(deposit, substrate, surface_bool, semi_surf_bool, ghosts_bool, flux_matrix, z_max)¶

Evolves surface upon a full deposition of a cell. This method holds has the vast majority of logic

Parameters

  • deposit – 3D deposit array

  • substrate – 3D precursor density array

  • surface_bool – array representing surface cells

  • semi_surf_bool – array representing semi-surface cells

  • ghosts_bool – array representing ghost cells

  • flux_matrix – matrix of electron flux distribution

  • z_max – highest point along Z axis

Returns

changes surface, semi-surface and ghosts arrays
